channel.title: Data Science on Johnny's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science on Johnny's Blog

item.title: The best of the EFL (for your FPL)
item.description: If the EFL championship could be summed up in one way it would be Gerhard Struber's interview on the final day of the season when his side, Barnsley, managed a dramatic win in the 91st minute over automatic promotion contenders Brentford to secure their place in the EFL championship next season. If you haven't watched this already, you need to: Watch the full length post-match interview with a teary eyed Gerhard Struber following @BarnsleyFc’s great escape!

item.title: The evolution of the Tour De France
item.description: The Dreyfus affair “I swear that I am innocent. I remain worthy of serving in the Army. Long live France! Long live the Army!” These were the famous words uttered by Alfred Dreyfus as he was convicted by fellow French officials in a secret court martial back in 1895, following allegations of espionage and treason against the French state. The incident - commonly referred to as the ‘Dreyfus affair’ - went down as one of the most controversial and polarising political dramas in all of French history.

item.title: The perils of medical testing
item.description: You’ve been feeling under the weather for more than a couple of days and things don’t seem to be improving. So, you pluck up the courage to call your local doctor. He tells you that it’s probably just an innocuous virus but he decides to run a series of remote tests on you regardless, ‘just to be safe’. The next day you receive your results: your doctor informs you that you have tested positive for a very serious disease that only affects approximately 5% of the global population.
